comments.author: EdGames8

comments.text:
Sono video motivazionali, guarda gli altri, arrivano anche a 4 milioni di 
visualizzazioni e sono decisamente più brutti. Meno immagini, un'unica 
traccia audio, al massimo due ma neanche mixxate, pochi dialoghi, molto più 
semplici e meno elaborati. 
Ma siamo in Italia, tirerà sempre di più quello che fa ridere di un piccolo 
pezzo d'arte. Alla fine ci ritroveremo tutti a guardare chi scoreggia sulla 
gente. 
Siete obiettivamente ignoranti. Chi non parla l'inglese, chi non capisce 
che questo video non è fatto per gli italiani, chi non capisce le scene... 
è ignoranza. Le scene trasmettono. è empatia. è un flusso che ti prende e 
ti fa rizzare i peli. Non c'è un senso esatto. è un motivational. Sono 
immagini forti, di chi si è riscattato, di chi ci ha messo l'anima, di chi 
ha vinto. E Steve Jobs è l'idolo dei motivational. Praticamente sono 
partiti tutti da lui e dal suo discorso all'università. E ciò che dice è 
splendido, così veritiero, così incoraggiante. L'uomo che fu licenziato 
dalla sua stessa azienda e che finì quasi sull'orlo del fallimento. L'uomo 
che poi cambiò un'epoca, nel bene o nel male. 
Si ma, ripeto, ennesima volta, siamo in Italia. Benvenuta l'ignoranza. 
Io, Youtuber italiano, faccio un video trenta volte più bello e complesso 
degli altri motivational in giro e arrivano a 3 mila views.
Un altro, Youtuber americano, con un video più semplice, meno originale, 
più banale e scontato, 4 milioni. 
Dovevo nascere in america, questo è un paese per capre ignoranti. 
Discussione chiusa ^^
comments.author: Bloodymoonsky

top_comment.text:
A riguardarlo... a me i sottotitoli non piacciono. Il fatto che si legga, 
razionalizza il cervello e si perde l'epicità del video. Si perde il phatos 
delle voci, delle immagini, diventa tutto troppo razionale e si rischia di 
concentrarsi troppo sul concetto in sé della frase, perdendo quello che il 
video vuole lasciare, perdendo la carica. Devo proprio tenerli sti 
sottotitoli? Non lo so... sono davvero tremendi. Piuttosto vi faccio io un 
corso d'inglese accelerato... Ma è uno stupro al mio lavoro aver inserito i 
sottotitoli... Ditemi voi. Io penso che tolgano tantissimo di ciò che 
lascia il video senza nessun sottotitolo. ﻿
top_comment.author: Bloodymoonsky

top_comment.text:
it sometimes bores me that in these videos you usually see athletes. for me 
it's always easier to physically power through any workout (and i'm not 
that athletic) that doesn't even matter to me, than to sit on my fucking 
desk and do the work i am really afraid of, the work that really threatens 
my feeling of self worth and triggers all the anxiety about my future i can 
imagine. most people aren't athletes. just workers. who have to fight 
through college and ordinary daily stuff. sometimes getting up alone is a 
struggle for me. of course motivational music with showing a guy getting up 
isn't very powerful :P but still..﻿
top_comment.author: Knight Brienne (Brienne of Tarth)

comments.text:
Athletes considered to be virtuous in ancient Greece. Between Greek 
kingdoms and city/states an Olympian athlete considered to be the most 
superior honor of all. According to anc. Hellenic world an Olympian 
Athletes considered to be blessed and more close with Olympian Gods. A 
great achievement. That is the reason EVERYBODY wanted to try! However i 
understand your fears. I have the same sometimes... Ancient greeks said. "A 
healthy mind, in a healthy body" (Free translation) νοῦς ὑγιής ἐν σώματι 
ὑγιεῖ , "all in good measure, all in moderation, moderation is the best 
thing" (Free translation) παν μέτρον άριστον and last but not least. αἰὲν 
ἀριστεύειν which means "ever excel" from the famous phrase in Homer's Iliad 
book "Ever to excel, to do better than others, and to bring glory to your 
forebears, who indeed were very great ... This is my ancestry; this is the 
blood I am proud to inherit."  Ahhh. Such a nice constructive philosophy 
and morphosis they had. (I hope, I helped)
comments.author: Ioannis “Hogosha” Kapsalakis

comments.text: I understand u.
comments.author: Joseph Ramses

comments.text:
yeah. know they are human and just work hard. there are also motivational 
vids out there showing students and workers. it just works better for me. i 
think it is a different struggle because you can't let out your feelings 
there like you maybe can when exercising. the frustration and difficulties 
are different. it's more about forcing yourself down and stand the feeling 
of being trapped and tied to a place or work you feel is a chore right now 
(study, fighting your way through not so good jobs and opportunities, 
taking bs from others). often it feels like it can't be actively DONE so 
much (like exercise) and is more about endurance. they surely both have in 
common the momentarily struggle for a bigger goal.
comments.author: Knight Brienne (Brienne of Tarth)

comments.text:
I feel you clearly Knight. I am currently working on a program that will 
achieve this transfer of these principles to those who feel they cant 
relate and are not "athletes".
It is extremely important to know that these "super athletes" are more 
often ( 95%) just really normal people who put these principles into life 
constantly and with unwavering faith.
I hope this is of some help.

comments.author: Knight Brienne (Brienne of Tarth)

comments.text:
To achieve the highest level of success in any Sport it takes an Athlete 
many many years of dedication and commitment without any guarantees or free 
rides. They follow very specific routines, goals and plans and they follow 
them through pain and disappointment. All the way to the top. If any person 
were to follow the same dedication and constant striving, they would 
ultimately achieve success in any field or endeavour. The same methodology 
works in every aspect of life.
comments.author: Being in the zone

comments.text:
You raise a very good point. I too find it much harder to challenge myself 
intellectually than physically. I feel this is the same for most people
comments.author: Aspiring to Inspire

comments.text:
I hear you. Athletes, fighters, symbolize that great battle within each of 
us - we can see it in every line of their bodies, in the blood, pain, in 
the way they put themselves out there, the risks they take, the heart they 
give. They are the greater parts of ourselves and we share their victories 
because these are human victories. Stallone's Rocky shows this so 
beautifully, because that dialogue comes from his own story, from having 
nothing but heart and walking around with the story of Rocky, trying to 
sell it while at rockbottom and having the determination to act, when 
no-one would have him. That's why his words are in most of these - he lived 
it and therefore could write it, and he chose the fighter, for that very 
reason:)
comments.author: Charda Schalkwyk

comments.text:
+Alpha4plaYer Intrigued to know if you are still suffering from this? I am 
a sales trainer, motivational speaker and NLP Practitioner. My advice is 
simple - No amount of music, tv, radio or anything will make you overcome 
this, only YOU can overcome this, the way to overcome your fear's is by 
doing them, everyday. If you are scared to speak to strangers open your 
mouth and speak to them, start with small questions like "Have you got the 
time?" if you are still hitting the gym ask a PT for advice, or crack up a 
conversation with a fellow gym member (you will have things in common) More 
you do it the easier it will become. Good Luck.
comments.author: Tony Tomlinson

comments.author: rocker3277

top_comment.text:
This video gave me chills. I want to be a fighter pilot, and about four 
years ago, I had no chance at all. I had no middle school or high school 
education. I had a very bad time, I was in survival mode, living off of a 
garden I grew for food, and chickens a neighbor gave me for helping with 
their yard. It was winter, no power, snowing out, when I took a shower, the 
floor of the shower cracked with ice, and the water was so cold that I 
pulled muscles from the uncontrolled shivering. I got sick, a neighbor 
helped me get better, then took me to a mental health center. My interview 
with a therapist resulted in him giving me a card for a GED center. 
Eventually I got power back, internet, then messaged the GED center, then 
that neighbor started taking me there (she had nothing else better to do). 
After a few months, I got my GED, started working next door on a 
construction site, then my boss taught me how to drive, gave me advice 
about college, then the following Christmas, he bought me an old car, after 
I got my drivers license. I got into a junior college, struggled through 
math, then got very good with English and some other classes, and graduated 
five semester later. Not, I am on my first semester at a university, 
attacking Aerospace Engineering, while in the Air Force ROTC program. My 
GPA is currently a 3.24. I am struggling with Chemistry and Trig, but am 
slowly learning what I need to in order to get ahead. The entire time, I 
have had many put me down, tell me I will never make it, and will never be 
a fighter pilot, that it is too hard, that I am not smart enough, that I 
will fall flat on my face. When I was in middle school (was taken out not 
even half way through the first semester because of bad teachers), the 
teacher told me I will end up on the streets holding a sign for food, or 
whatever. What got me here is the advice given to me by those who cared. 
The advice I got was to take steps, to learn every class as as much as I 
possibly could. Because if I don't take steps, I will stay on the ground, 
and never make it to the sky. What I did so far was climb out of a 
basement, and have climbed up a few levels. Now I can see that I have a 
very good change to be a fighter pilot, to make my dreams come true, and to 
prove those fuckers who put me down wrong. What keeps me going is knowing 
that others told me I would never make it in to a college, or would never 
graduate. Knowing I have graduated has proven to myself that I can do it, 
and now I am striving for the top. The ammo to my will is proving wrong 
those who told me I can't. Tell me I can't do something, and watch me prove 
them wrong by doing it. I won't let those fuckers tell me it can't be done, 
because I did it, and am doing it. The sky is the limit, and beyond that is 
space, and there are no limits in space.﻿

because I am my own worst enemy-yet I will never be satisfied to stay

comments.author: Iwasonceacarpenter

comments.text:
you have to get your things together and believe in yourself! thats the 
most important Thing ... even if you failed a lot - so did I. But you're 
still a human being. so we have to get your Motivation from the believing 
in yourself! no one was Born as a loser, but it's easier to become a loser 
than a Champion! it's a mind set! Keep your chin up bro! there's always a 
path to daylight!

motivation doesnt last, neither does bathing, thats why we recommend it

comments.author: Knight Brienne (Brienne of Tarth)

comments.text:
Motivation is only temporary, it is for all of us. Use the motivation to 
begin the habit. If you do something, anything, one time, you can do it 
again, again, and again, as long as it takes to get a track record of 
success. That will get you anywhere. Good luck, get going and don't ever 
give up.

top_comment.text:
i need help i want to train basketball but i'm to shy to meet other people 
i'm afraid they will judge me please someone give me advice﻿
top_comment.author: Benjamin Kadric

comments.text:
man i cant help you im the same but ... i cant describe my shyness im not 
afraid that they will laugh or judge me its just sometimes when im talking 
to someone i cant open my mouth for no reason i know what i want to say but 
i cant ... manytimes i have broke that shyness but sometimes i cant im shy 
to go to sports too for the same reason i dont know what it is ... if 
someone knows a music i want music to listen while im doing sports that 
will motivate me it will help a lot and if you are going to say : find a 
girl friend or something like that i really liked one girl and i was really 
confident i started going to the gum for her but after all i saw she had a 
boyfriend ... and if someone like i said knows a really good song it will 
be awesome !
comments.author: Alpha4plaYer

comments.text:
shoot until your wrist hurts, do ballhandling drills till the ball sticks 
to your hands, watch the best basketball players and try to copy their 
moves, run and workout to jump higher. Most importantly you need to play 
with others better than you and train until you beat them, then repeat the 
process with stronger opponents; you will lose, you will get crossovered, 
outrebounded but it's the only way to become the best you can be!
of course you will be mocked and judged by assholes, but it will make you 
only stronger ;)
comments.author: vicmer ferrer

comments.text:
Look forward and look at that ball. It doesn't matter what people say or 
how they look because the only thing that matters is that ball and the 
passion you have for it. If they laugh who cares? You have to focus on what 
you want and not let others distract you. I guarantee you that everything 
will be fine, you have to get through that shyness and show it whos boss, 
even if your scared just do it anyway because fear and shyness are just 
feelings. The greatest basketball players had to start somewhere, they were 
shy/scared but they still did it and focused on what they wanted. I may not 
know you but I believe in you :) go out there and do your best and train 
your hardest.
comments.author: Axelarateofrayni

captions.text: I don't know what to say, really.
Three minutes to the biggest battle of our professional lives.
All comes down to today,
and either,
we heal
as a team

or we gonna crumble.
Inch by inch,
play by play. Until we're finished.
We're in hell right now.

But I tell you there are some times in life where you fall down 
and feel like you don't have the strength to get back up.
So you sort put a mask on your face and come to school
and pretend that everything is okay when it's not and you go home
and lay in your bed when no one's looking at you,

when you don't have to impress anybody 
and you're yourself.
And fear comes in.

You know the fear that you have as soon as
you walk into the doors of your house?
Maybe is a broken home
Maybe you have doubt in your life
Maybe you don't know for sure what's going on to be happening in the future and it scares you.
Maybe about, maybe you're worried about what people think about you,
what people say about you.
Just that fear paralyzes you
and I just want to ask to you today:
do you think you have hope?
Let me tell you something you already know.
The world ain't all sunshine and rainbows.
It's a very mean and nasty place
and I don't care how tough you are
it will beat you to your knees and keep you there permanently if you let it
You, me, or nobody is gonna hit as hard as life
but it ain't about how hard you hit
it's about how hard you can get hit
and keep moving forward
how much you can take and keep moving forward
That's how winning is done!
Pain is temporary
it may last for a minute, or an hour,
or a day, or even a year
but eventually
it will subside
and something else will take its place.
If I quit however, it will last forever
I'm down here
face down
and I have no arms and no legs.
It should be impossible for me to get back up.
It should be impossible for me to get back up. But it's not.
You see, I will try 100 times to get up
and if I fail 100 times, if I fail and I give up
do you think that I'm ever going to give up? No!
But if I fail and I try again?
And again and again?
For as long as I try there is always that chance of me getting up
You find out life's game inches
so is football
Because in either game, life or football
the margin for error is so small
I mean
one half a step too late or too early and you don't quite make it
one half second too slow, too fast and you don't quite catch it
the inches we need are everywhere around us
Now, if you know what you're worth, then go out and get what you're worth.
But you gotta be willing to take the hits, and not pointing fingers saying
you ain't where you wanna be because of him, or her, or anybody
Cowards do that and that ain't you. You better than that!
The most important thing is this: to be able at any moment
to sacrifice
what you are
for what you will become
I'm saying to you today that there are some of you,
if you give up your cellphone you will be successful
Some of you need to give up your cellphones because the time you spent
on your cellphones
could be use for your successful!
The time you can be using to be successful you're using on the cell
and the cellphones is not bringing nothing but a bill.
Very often you're getting what you're asking for
you is not aware of how general you're asking
Clarity is power! The more clear you are about exactly what do you want and more your brain knows how to get there.
You're brain is a survival mechanism.
If you don't know exactly what you want or let yourself get me on that something general you're not going to achieve
Clarity is power. You gotta love the specific result you have to what you want.
You can answer the question right now in your personal life, in your body,
in your relationship and your finances and your spirituality
you're not going to be as simple as you want to be
Says: it's easy to be on the bottom, it doesn't take the half to be a loser
Does taking the motivation and drive and none stays out there on a
low-level but it calls on everything, me and you, ladies and gentleman
you have the hot issue to say: I'm going to challenge myself
sometimes I have to pull myself out a bit. Came on!
Things I know I should do I don't do, things I shouldn't do I do
I find that the biggest enemy you have to deal with is yourself!
Let no man forget
how menacing we are, we are lions! Immortality!
Don't tell me what I can't do!
Of course it was impossible to connect the dots
looking forward when I was in collage
But it was very, very clear looking backwards 10 years later.
Again,
you can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards.
So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future.
You have to trust in something,
your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever.
Because believing that the dots will connect down the road
will give you the confidence
to follow your heart.
Even when it leads you off the well worn path and that will make all the difference
I'm gonna show you how great I am!

title: The Ultimate Motivational Video - To The Glory! -
